Welcome to the IntelliStream Research Group

We are a young and dynamic research group. From a high-level point of view, our research goal is to optimize and utilize distributed and parallel stream processing technology to better support existing and emerging big data applications. This is important to improve performance and reduce resource consumption, especially for the network connected world by 5G, IoT, etc. Our work spanning around database management, networking systems, machine learning, and data mining.

Previous Next

For more information and other opportunities on how to join take a look here!

– We are pleased to announce the formation of Special Interest Groups (SIGs) of presentations within our Research Group. These SIGs aim to foster specialized knowledge sharing and to improve our capabilities in English presentations. We decided to make it openly accessible, so that everyone interested can participate.

Upcoming Schedule: Presentation schedules will be updated periodically and can be accessed at Intellistream Meetings.

For active participation, please join the corresponding Slack channels.

– We are grateful for generous fundings from National Research Foundation, Singapore and Infocomm Media Development Authority under its Future Communications Research & Development Programme, Ministry of Education (MOE) of Singapore, Temasek Labs@SUTD, SUTD-ZJU IDEA office, and SUTD Kickstarter Initiative (SKI) office.

News

12/Sep/2023

We have a new preprint out, Benne: A Modular and Self-Optimizing Algorithm for Data Stream Clustering

2/Sep/2023

Our preprint about a survey of transactional stream processing is accepted to VLDB Journal! TL;DR: Transactional stream processing (TSP) strives to create a cohesive model that merges the advantages of both transactional and stream-oriented guarantees. This survey intends to introduce TSP and present our perspective on its future progression. Our primary goals are twofold: to provide insights into the diverse TSP requirements and methodologies, and to inspire the design and development of groundbreaking TSP systems.

15/Aug/2023

Shuhao Zhang will join School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) as an assistant professor in November 2023.

18/July/2023

Our preprint on a vision for ``Harnessing Scalable Transactional Stream Processing (TSP) for Managing Large Language Models (LLMs)'' is now available online. If you have questions, comments, or suggestions, feel free to write an email to me: shuhao_zhang AT sutd.edu.sg. We also welcome criticism, collaboration opprotutnities, and others.

27/June/2023

We built a Python API of our sesame project, which aims at building a scalable stream mining library on modern hardware. Currently, it contains several representative real-world stream clustering algorithms and several synthetic algorithms. We welcome your contributions, if you are interested to contribute to the project, please fork and submit a PR. If you have questions, feel free to log an issue or write an email to shuhao_zhang AT sutd.edu.sg.

25/June/2023

We have a new preprint out on the CStream: Parallel Data Stream Compression on Multicore Edge Device
